private_settings.name: subaccount_slug
private_settings.title: Subaccount Slug
private_settings.description: If you use **multiple sub-accounts**, you need to use a slug to prevent Hull from overwriting data. The slug will be appended to the attribute group, e.g. if you enter the slug `Marketing Germany` the resulting attribute group in Hull will be `mailjet_marketing_germany`. If you are not sure whether you have to use this or not, contact our Support team at [support@hull.io](mailto:support@hull.io).

private_settings.name: contact_synchronized_segments
private_settings.title: Contact Filter
private_settings.description: Send users as contacts when they belong to one of these segments to Mailjet. Only users in the specified segments are sent.

private_settings.name: contact_attributes_outbound
private_settings.title: User attributes mapping
private_settings.description: The connector automatically maps and uses the Hull attribute `email` as value for the property Email. This is required for identity resolution and cannot be changed. The default Mailjet property `Name` is indicated by the `(*)` prefix in case you have a custom attribute with the same label.
